604fcbbc-2dce-4236-9b0a-2e530d49065a Saskatchewan seeks to develop SMR supply chainSaskatchewan's Crown Investments Corporation is providing CAD479,000 (USD352,296) to the Saskatchewan Industrial and Mining Suppliers Association and its partners to prepare local companies for their future participation in provincial, national and global small modular reactor development. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 14:01:54 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Saskatchewan-seeks-to-develop-SMR-supply-chain?feed=feed
bc9c191d-c419-447c-ba12-3576673d81e4 Xcel gets approval to expand used fuel storage at MonticelloThe Minnesota Public Utilities Commission has approved Xcel Energy's application to allow increased storage of used nuclear fuel at the Monticello nuclear power plant site, enabling the plant to operate for at least ten more years. The utility has applied to extend the plant's operating licence until 2050. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 12:16:29 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Xcel-gets-OK-to-expand-used-fuel-storage-at-Montic?feed=feed
a6f07c03-c87e-450f-b979-de7ccab8858c Orano completes first cut of Crystal River reactor vesselOrano USA has completed work to separate and pack the top third of the reactor vessel, with its embedded internal components, using its patented Optimized Segmentation process. The reactor vessel will be cut into three segments as the company carries out accelerated decommissioning of the plant. Thu, 24 Aug 2023 22:50:56 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Orano-completes-first-cut-of-Crystal-River-reactor?feed=feed
28f2cd2c-c43d-4a55-be8c-c1abbeb2e023 Slovenské elektrárne and Westinghouse fuel supply agreementA long-term agreement with Westinghouse for the licensing and supply of VVER-440 fuel assemblies has been signed as part of Slovenské elektrárne's efforts to diversify its supplies for power plants in Slovakia. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 11:59:49 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Slovenske-Elektrarne-and-Westinghouse-sign-fuel-su?feed=feed
f1c9a5da-3320-431a-b35b-bb60e0c113c5 Concreting of outer dome completed at Kursk IIAbout 4000 cubic metres of concrete were used to complete the dome of the outer containment of the first unit at Kursk II nuclear power plant in Russia. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 13:42:12 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Concreting-of-outer-dome-completed-at-Kursk-II?feed=feed
e03a77a3-b0ae-4702-b3ef-57875b617ed6Japan starts discharging treated water into the seaTokyo Electric Power Company announced it has begun releasing treated water currently stored at the damaged Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant into the ocean. The operation - expected to take up to 30 years to complete - is being closely monitored by the International Atomic Energy Agency. Thu, 24 Aug 2023 11:12:26 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Japan-starts-discharging-treated-water-into-the-se?feed=feed
b290ff66-e9cb-4f8d-8c9e-b7f3b1c74324Studsvik considers SMR deployment at Nyköping siteSwedish nuclear technical services provider Studsvik has signed a memorandum of understanding with small modular reactor project development company Kärnfull Next, which is investigating the possibility of constructing and operating SMRs on the Studsvik industrial site near Nyköping on Sweden's east coast. Thu, 24 Aug 2023 13:23:19 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Studsvik-considers-SMR-deployment-at-Nykoping-site?feed=feed
b024d462-3165-4e0c-895e-2e81cbbe81c9 OPG ad campaign recasts nuclearOntario Power Generation has launched a new public education campaign that uses the power of movies to tackle misperceptions of nuclear power. Thu, 24 Aug 2023 14:29:45 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/OPG-ad-campaign-recasts-nuclear?feed=feed
a12a968c-b5ac-4c3a-a66f-893f18152b9a Grafenrheinfeld reaches new decommissioning milestoneThe process of treating, cleaning and emptying the 14-metre-deep fuel element storage pool at the Grafenrheinfeld nuclear power plant in Germany has been completed. It follows the emptying and cleaning of the reactor pool at the end of last year. Thu, 24 Aug 2023 12:05:53 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Grafenrheinfeld-reaches-new-decommissioning-milest?feed=feed
eb5fba7a-18bd-46ba-a530-e428f1311894 UK funding to ensure Ukrainian nuclear fuel suppliesThe UK government has announced it will provide a GBP192 million (USD243 million) loan guarantee to enable UK-headquartered Urenco to supply Energoatom, Ukraine's national nuclear company, with uranium enrichment services. The UK government also agreed a Memorandum of Understanding committing support to Ukraine's energy sector and green energy future. Wed, 23 Aug 2023 12:20:58 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/UK-funding-to-ensure-Ukrainian-nuclear-fuel-suppli?feed=feed
a543b997-97c4-49cd-ac51-2c18de48e239 Groundwater extraction begins at ZaporizhzhiaThe Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant has started pumping water from a new groundwater well and plans to build more at the site as part of efforts to ensure sufficient cooling for its six reactors after the destruction of Ukraine's Kakhovka dam in early June. Wed, 23 Aug 2023 14:44:19 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Groundwater-extraction-begins-at-Zaporizhzhia?feed=feed
